Key Arguments: The proposed bill would severely restrict freedom of speech and expression in Australia.
ACMA would have the power to unilaterally decide what information is true or false.
It is not the role of the government to determine truth or fact-check opinions.
Defining false, misleading, or deceptive information is nearly impossible, especially in science.
Past instances during the pandemic showed that information labeled as misinformation was later proven correct.
The bill could lead to censorship and suppression of dissenting views, turning digital platforms into government propaganda tools.
The bill threatens the free marketplace of ideas and could lead to authoritarian censorship.
Notable Quotes: This proposed bill would severely restrict freedom of speech and expression in Australia.
It is not the role of the government or any government body to tell what is or is not the truth online.
The bill could ultimately be used to completely silence everyone on social media who disagrees with any 'official' narrative.
This bill would signal the end of the free marketplace of ideas online and would create scope for manipulation, control and authoritarian censorship.
